Package displays

Class PawnPromotionDisplay

java.lang.Object
displays.PawnPromotionDisplay
public class PawnPromotionDisplay extends Object
The display for Pawn Promotion. When a pawn reaches the final row (any tile on rows 1 & 8), this display is presented. Prompts the client to pick which specialty piece the pawn is being promoted to. The default is Queen, but Rook, Knight, and Bishop are options as well. It returns the String of the piece the client wishes to promote their pawn to. This is called from Chessboard's checkPromotion() method. Since every display utilizes selection listeners, a separate class with the method 'selectListenCreation()' is used to add a selection listener.
Author:
Jonathan Houge

  • Method Details

    • start

      public String start(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display display)
      The start method creates and runs the display (shell) itself. It utilizes functions to create the different kinds of radio buttons and creates textual widgets right then and there. The display stays open until the user clicks the "Promote!" button. In then collects the entered information and returns it.
      Parameters:
      display - : Display object, the Chessboard's Display
      Returns:
      String of what piece the client wants their pawn to be promoted to

    • colorButtons

      private static void colorButtons(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell shell, ArrayList<String> decision, org.eclipse.swt.layout.RowLayout layout, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font title, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Font button, org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Color color)
      Radio button for picking pawn promotion. Makes the buttons 'Rook', 'Knight', 'Bishop', and 'Queen' in their own group, using the given layout, fonts, and color. Adds a selection listener to each button.
      Parameters:
      shell - : the shell that we're adding the buttons to
      decision - : the ArrayList that'll be added to whenever the user picks a new option
      layout - : the layout that the widgets will conform to
      title - : the font for the group's label / title
      button - : the font for the button's themselves
      color - : the color that the label and buttons will be
